OOC: No problem.

BIC:  

Within his spark, Tucson was still convinced that=
 even though his efforts to restore some of the structures were slow and mi=
nute, there was still a chance that something could be saved on Atlantis.  =
But now there was no time for that.  The Tsunami was at hand, and the decis=
ion to leave was valid.  As he helps to load things onto airtankers, he can=
 not help but feel that edge of anger he had been carrying ever since the w=
ar that left him blinded.  

" Thank you for your kind words Lord Perseus. =
 I also wish the same as you do."  

As he assists to the best of his abili=
ties, he thinks to himself.

" If it were up to me, I would take care of th=
e problem at it's roots.  Things wouldn't be this way if the Decepticons ha=
dn't initiated that first war to begin with.  Megatron wishes to make peace=
, well, it's a little too late for that as far as I'm concerned."

He loads=
 materials onto an airtanker, and steps off for a moment.  It was obvious h=
e had not yet blown the steam he needed to blow and was not about to do tha=
t on the airtanker.  

"If you would excuse me for a moment Lord Perseus, I=
 need to step away for a moment."  

He transforms into SUV mode and speeds=
 off to a secluded space not far from the airtanker.  Here, lonely boulders=
 grip the waterfront, and he knew this would serve a better place to vent h=
is frustrations.

He returns to robot mode, and the first boulder he sees, =
he punches it hard, cracking it, and leaving an indentation in the rock its=
elf.

" That's what I think about Megatron!"  

He puches it several more t=
imes and then lets out a scream of frustration.  After his venting he takes=
 time to count to ten and then calms down again enough to return to the air=
tankers, once again coming across as mild mannered as he always has while r=
emaining on Atlantis.

" I appologize for that quick absense.  Thank you." =
 

He gets into SUV mode and slowly rolls up more material into the air tan=
ker.  His emotions somewhat vented but not fully, he returns to robot mode =
to further assist in the loading of the airtanker, finding that hands serve=
 better than wheels.  He was sad to leave, and even more angry that the ene=
my who had caused most damage in the past, now desires truce among his kind=
 and the Maxmials.  He would have no part of it personally but felt trapped=
 that he had to comply to this.  He would comply, yet he knew he did not ha=
ve to be friendly with the opposing faction.   For now, helping Lord Perseu=
s was a healthy distraction for his anger, as he continues to work consista=
ntly to help in the move.
